articles.description: Arsenal's win against Manchester City could be one of the most significant moments in Mikel Arteta's career if it has the galvanising impact it should have, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Man City win could be Arteta's most significant yet'

articles.description: Portugal shock Fiji with win in Toulouse, but a losing bonus point is enough to send Fiji into a Rugby World Cup quarter-final against England.
articles.title: Fiji lose to Portugal but advance to England match

articles.description: Mercedes drivers Lewis Hamilton and George Russell collided at the start before Max Verstappen went on to dominate the Qatar Grand Prix.
articles.title: Verstappen wins in Qatar as Hamilton and Russell collide

articles.description: Match of the Day 2's Danny Murphy and Alan Shearer analyse how Arsenal prevented Manchester City from playing their usual game, and claimed a 1-0 win.
articles.title: 'Haaland hardly had a kick' - How Arsenal stopped Man City playing

articles.description: The 26 seconds that Alex Greenwood used up before taking a free-kick for Manchester City proved more costly than expected in their 1-1 draw with Chelsea.
articles.title: 'Ridiculous' red card mars Man City draw with Chelsea

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says forward Bukayo Saka will not join up with England for October's international fixtures.
articles.title: Saka not available for England, says Arteta

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his eighth Premier League Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who was 'cool as ice'? - Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: Watch the key moments as Argentina beat Japan, Tonga defeat Romania and Portugal snatch victory against Fiji at the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Wins for Argentina, Portugal and Tonga at Rugby World Cup

articles.description: Teenager Lamine Yamal becomes the youngest goalscorer in La Liga history as Barcelona fight back from two goals down to earn a point against Granada.
articles.title: Barcelona fight back as teenager Yamal sets record

articles.description: Virat Kohli made a decisive 85 as World Cup hosts India overcame a early collapse to begin their campaign with a seven-wicket win over Australia.
articles.title: Kohli inspires India to victory over Australia
